isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Service Manual - Mounting Engine on Stand - Mounting Engine on Stand - Service Procedure

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, disconnect the main battery negative terminal before disconnecting or connecting any electrical components. See "Safety Information."

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not tug on any sensor wiring harnesses while trying to remove them. If resistance is felt, find the source of resistance and free any connectors or clips that are caught before proceeding.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death: Do not allow used engine fluids to stay on your skin. Clean your skin and nails with soap and water, or a good hand cleaner. Wash or properly throw away clothing or rags containing used engine fluids. Used engine fluids contain certain elements that may be unhealthy for skin and could even cause cancer. See "Safety Information."
To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, make sure that the engine has cooled down sufficiently before attempting to remove any components. See "Safety Information."

note.para: Engine fluids, oil, fuel, and coolant can be a threat to the environment. Never dispose of engine fluids by putting them in the trash, pouring them on the ground, in the sewers, in streams, or bodies of water.
Refer to the manufacturer's instructions (included with engine stand and engine stand bracket) for specific directions on their safe use.

step1.para: Remove the starter if not done during engine removal.
Remove oil filter cap from filter housing to allow oil to drain back into the oil pan. This must be done before removing the oil drain plug.
Remove oil pan drain plug and drain oil into a suitable container.

figure.caption: Location of left side coolant drain plug
Location of right side coolant drain plug

step1.para: Drain coolant from crankcase into a suitable container by removing the two coolant drain plugs. The coolant drain plugs are located at the rear of the crankcase on each side of the engine, just below the exhaust manifolds.
After all fluids are drained from the engine, install drain plugs into crankcase and oil pan. Tighten oil pan drain plug tothe Special Torque.
Disconnect the CKP harness connector from the sensor on the right side of engine.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, attach the hoist hook lifting bracket to the engine lifting eyes before lifting the engine. See "Safety Information."

step1.para: Attach hoist to the engine lifting eyes. Use safety catches on the hoist hooks when lifting engine.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, use only grade 8 bolts when mounting engine to stand. Other grade bolts may shear, allowing the engine to fall off the engine stand.

note.para: Use the Engine Stand Mounting Bracket when mounting an engine to the stand. See Special Service Tools.

figure.caption: Torquing Engine Stand Mounting Bracket to engine

calloutgroup.callout1: Engine stand bracket grade 8 mounting bolts (4)

step1.para: Position engine stand mounting bracket on right side of engine. Secure bracket plate with four grade 8 mounting bolts and washers. Tighten four mounting bolts to the Standard Torque.
Mount engine with mounting bracket on the engine stand using four grade 8 mounting bolts.
Tighten engine stand bolts to the Standard Torque.
